Class SameGameModel

java.lang.Object
com.aoopproject.framework.core.AbstractGameModel
com.aoopproject.games.samegame.SameGameModel
public class SameGameModel extends AbstractGameModel
Implements the game logic for SameGame. This class is responsible for managing the grid of SameGameTiles, processing game-specific player actions like tile selections and hint requests, calculating scores, applying game mechanics (tile removal, gravity, column compaction), and determining win/loss conditions.

It extends AbstractGameModel, relying on the superclass to handle common framework actions (New Game, Undo, Quit) and to manage observers, game status, score, and the undo history stack. The game's difficulty (rows, columns, number of colors) is determined by a DifficultyLevel set at construction.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    SameGameModel.PredefinedColors
    Helper inner class to define a palette of standard colors for the game tiles and a placeholder color for empty slots created during internal game logic (e.g., after gravity or column compaction).
    static class 
    SameGameModel.SameGameTilePosition
    Helper inner class to represent a tile's position (row and column) on the game grid.

  • Constructor Details

    • SameGameModel

      public SameGameModel(DifficultyLevel difficulty)
      Constructs a SameGameModel with the specified difficulty level. Initializes the list of available colors based on the difficulty.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - The DifficultyLevel defining the game's parameters (rows, columns, number of colors). Must not be null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if difficulty is null.

    • SameGameModel

      public SameGameModel()
      Default constructor that initializes the game with DifficultyLevel.MEDIUM. This is used if no specific difficulty is explicitly provided.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentDifficulty

      public DifficultyLevel getCurrentDifficulty()
      Gets the current difficulty level of the game.
      Returns:
      The current DifficultyLevel.

    • initializeGame

      public void initializeGame()
      Initializes or resets the game to its starting state based on the currentDifficulty. This involves:
      • Creating a new game board (AbstractGameModel.gameBoard) with dimensions from the current difficulty.
      • Filling the board with SameGameTiles of random colors chosen from the available palette based on the number of colors specified by the current difficulty.
      • Resetting the score to 0.
      • Setting the game status to GameStatus.PLAYING.
      • Clearing the undo history stack.
      • Notifying observers with "BOARD_INITIALIZED", "SCORE_UPDATED", and "NEW_GAME_STARTED" events. The "NEW_GAME_STARTED" event includes the current difficulty as its payload.
      Specified by:
      initializeGame in class AbstractGameModel

    • setTestGameBoard

      protected void setTestGameBoard(Grid<SameGameTile> testBoard, DifficultyLevel testDifficulty, GameStatus initialStatus)
      Sets the game board to a predefined grid and difficulty for testing purposes. This method is intended for use in test environments to create specific scenarios. It reinitializes internal color lists based on the test difficulty, resets the score, sets the game status, clears the undo history, and notifies observers.
      Parameters:
      testBoard - The Grid of SameGameTiles to set as the current game board.
      testDifficulty - The DifficultyLevel to associate with this test board configuration.
      initialStatus - The GameStatus to set the game to (e.g., PLAYING).

    • processGameSpecificAction

      protected void processGameSpecificAction(GameAction action)
      Processes game-specific actions for SameGame, such as selecting a tile or requesting a hint. This method is called by AbstractGameModel.processInputAction(GameAction) when the game is in the GameStatus.PLAYING state and the action is not a common framework action (like New Game, Undo, or Quit).

      For a SameGameSelectAction:

      • Validates the selection (coordinates, non-empty tile).
      • Finds connected tiles of the same color.
      • If enough tiles are connected (>= MIN_TILES_TO_REMOVE):
        • Saves the current state (board, score) for undo.
        • Removes the tiles.
        • Applies gravity to shift remaining tiles down.
        • Compacts columns to remove empty ones.
        • Calculates and updates the score.
        • Notifies observers with "BOARD_CHANGED" and "TILES_REMOVED_SUCCESS" events.
        • Checks for end-game conditions.
      • If not enough tiles are connected, notifies observers with an "INVALID_SELECTION" event.
      For a HintRequestAction:
      • Calls suggestMove() to find the best immediate move.
      • Notifies observers with "MOVE_SUGGESTION_AVAILABLE" (with the suggested tile group) or "NO_SUGGESTION_AVAILABLE" events.

      Specified by:
      processGameSpecificAction in class AbstractGameModel
      Parameters:
      action - The game-specific GameAction to process.

    • undoLastMove

      public void undoLastMove()
      Undoes the last successfully processed move by restoring the game board and score from the history stack. Sets the game status back to PLAYING and notifies observers. This method is called by AbstractGameModel.processInputAction(GameAction) when an UndoAction is received and canUndo() is true.
      Specified by:
      undoLastMove in class AbstractGameModel

    • canUndo

      public boolean canUndo()
      Checks if an undo operation can currently be performed. An undo is possible if the AbstractGameModel.historyStack is not null and not empty.
      Specified by:
      canUndo in class AbstractGameModel
      Returns:
      true if an undo operation is possible, false otherwise.

    • isValidAction

      public boolean isValidAction(GameAction action)
      Validates if a given GameAction is permissible in the current SameGame state.
      • Common actions (NewGame, Undo, Quit) are validated by AbstractGameModel or their specific conditions.
      • A HintRequestAction is valid if the game is currently GameStatus.PLAYING.
      • A SameGameSelectAction is valid if the game is PLAYING, the selected coordinates are valid, the tile at those coordinates is not empty, and selecting it would result in removing at least MIN_TILES_TO_REMOVE tiles.
      Specified by:
      isValidAction in class AbstractGameModel
      Parameters:
      action - The GameAction to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the action is considered valid for processing, false otherwise.

    • checkEndGameConditions

      protected void checkEndGameConditions()
      Checks for SameGame's end-of-game conditions (win or loss). A loss occurs if no more valid moves (groups of MIN_TILES_TO_REMOVE or more) can be made. A win occurs if the board is completely empty (which also implies no more moves). Updates the AbstractGameModel.currentStatus and notifies observers if the game ends. If moves are available and status was not PLAYING (e.g., after an undo from game over), it sets the status back to PLAYING.
      Specified by:
      checkEndGameConditions in class AbstractGameModel

    • suggestMove

      public List<SameGameModel.SameGameTilePosition> suggestMove()
      Analyzes the current board state and suggests a group of tiles that, if clicked, would yield the highest immediate score based on the game's scoring rules.
      Returns:
      A List<SameGameTilePosition> representing the tiles in the suggested group. Returns an empty list if no valid moves are available or if the game is not in PLAYING state.

    • applyGravity

      protected void applyGravity()
      Applies gravity to the tiles on the board. After tiles are removed (marked as empty), tiles above the empty spaces fall down to fill them. Vacated upper cells are filled with new placeholder empty tiles. This method iterates using the actual dimensions of the current gameBoard. It is typically called after removeTiles(List). This method's visibility is protected for testing purposes.

    • compactColumns

      protected void compactColumns()
      Compacts columns by shifting non-empty columns to the left to fill any columns that became entirely empty after tile removal and gravity. Vacated columns on the right are filled with new placeholder empty tiles. This method iterates using the actual dimensions of the current gameBoard. It is typically called after applyGravity(). This method's visibility is protected for testing purposes.
